titlestmt.titleproper: Morris County Auxiliary Missionary Society records 1827-1848
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Morris County Auxiliary Missionary Society records

bioghist.p: The Morris County Auxiliary Missionary Society was formed in 1827 to raise funds in aid of missions the world over. The Society was affiliated with the American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of yearly meeting minutes of the Society, from 1827 to 1832. From 1832 to 1848 meetings were held more sporadically. The minutes consist primarily of reports of funds raised. The volume includes the constitution of the Society.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
